text: Hey <!channel> please check in via slack for standup today.
waiting on final height so I can modify rhino
also, are we going to try to reflow any components? If so I want to do a dry run on the reflow oven beforehand
err "modify the design in rhino" whatever
My tasks for today: 1. Follow up with Shashi. 2. Schedule Marc meeting for tomorrow. 3. Bring up intel Iot small home as a potential venue for this. 4. Need to go to the wine shop.

Friday: Finished cap emulator and set up the dev room's mac for demos and testing. Also cleaned up and optimized some code.

Today: Look into making the app faster. Fix a couple of bugs and hand off to Phillip for VQA.

0. Get temperature sensor working on Edison - will give it another hour or so 1. Modify a CRB so I can connect LEDs and test that part of the firmware 2. Integrate downstream writes with a color change (needs above first) 3. Get quotes for board fab and assembly 4. Select battery and get Josh final stackup height
<@U026NB2U2>: met the owner of Çest si Bon over the weekend, and he’d love to be part of our research phase. In the past he managed a cellar of ~7K bottles, now has ~1K. Was excited to talk with us.
<@U02F8LF2X>: I wasn’t planning on reflowing the boards since the connector is so fine-pitched.

attachments.title: Data Mining Indian Recipes Reveals New Food Pairing Phenomenon | MIT Technology Review
attachments.text: By studying the network of links between Indian recipes, computer scientists have discovered that the presence of certain spices makes a meal much less likely to contain ingredients with flavors in common.
attachments.fallback: MIT Technology Review: Data Mining Indian Recipes Reveals New Food Pairing Phenomenon | MIT Technology Review
